intro: Brachionidium demissum, commonly known as the small water flea, is a microscopic crustacean belonging to the order Cladocera. It is typically found in freshwater environments such as ponds, lakes, and slow-moving streams. This species is characterized by its transparent, elongated body and a pair of antennae used for movement. Brachionidium demissum plays a vital role in aquatic ecosystems as a primary consumer, feeding on algae and other microscopic organisms. Its presence is often an indicator of water quality and ecosystem health.
